 The government decides, starting tomorrow, Monday at twelve o'clock in the afternoon, to take a set of measures to cordon off the spread of the new Corona virus in the soil of the Casablanca labor force.

Based on the positive indicators of the epidemiological situation in the Kingdom of Morocco and the decrease in the number of infections with the emerging coronavirus, especially after the expansion of vaccination campaigns in our country, the Moroccan authorities have taken new gradual measures to ease restrictions on the movement of travelers wishing to enter the national territory.
These measures aim to facilitate the return of Moroccans residing abroad to the homeland.
In this context, it was decided to resume flights to and from the Kingdom of Morocco, starting on Tuesday, June 15, 2021.
Given that the Kingdom's airspace is still closed, these flights will take place under exceptional licenses.
This process will take place according to an approach that combines gradual openness - taking into account the development of the national and international epidemiological situation, and preserving the gains made by our country to prevent the spread of the Corona virus.
In this context, countries were classified into two lists, on the basis of the recommendations of the Ministry of Health, based on the official epidemiological data published by the World Health Organization or those countries themselves through their official websites.
Regulation "A" includes all countries that have positive indicators with regard to controlling the epidemiological situation, especially the spread of mutated mutations of the virus.
Where travelers coming from these countries - whether they are Moroccan citizens, foreigners residing in Morocco, citizens of those countries or foreigners residing in them - can enter Moroccan soil if they have a certificate of vaccination and / or a negative result of a PCR test dating back less than 48 hours From the date of entry into the national territory.
Holders of foreign vaccination certificates will benefit from the same privileges granted by the Moroccan vaccination certificate to Moroccan citizens within the national territory.
As for Regulation B, it concerns an exclusive list of all countries not concerned with the mitigation measures contained in Regulation A, which know the spread of mutated strains or the absence of accurate statistics on the epidemiological situation.
Passengers coming from the countries included in this list must obtain exceptional licenses before traveling, give a negative PCR test that dates back less than 48 hours from the date of entering the national territory, and then submit to a 10-day quarantine.
The list of countries included in lists "A" and "B" will be published on a regular basis on the websites of the ministries in charge of foreign affairs, health and tourism. The two regulations will be subject to a periodic update, at least twice a month and whenever necessary.
As for the return of Moroccan citizens residing abroad, by sea, within the framework of the “Welcome 2021” operation, it will take place from the same sea transit points that were implemented during the past year and according to the health conditions specified above, noting that in addition to the PCR analysis they made In order to board the ship, the arrivals will undergo a second PCR analysis during the trip, in order to ensure the maximum health safety for them and their families.
